intro: Paepalanthus mollis, commonly known as the silky broomstick, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and shrublands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely used in horticulture.
